content.description: Sit start with hands matched on the top of the triangle looking block, with low and out right. Pull off the ground and bump the right hand up to the jug edge, match, and then trend left using either the small seam or going straight out to the left arete. Adjust the right hand and then bump the left up the arete until you hit a good edge near the lip, adjust feet, and reach with the right to the top ad pull up an easy mantle.
content.location: Left arete of this small face. The starting holds are on a small block that looks like an upside-down triangle.

content.description: Sit start at the base of the crack with wide feet. Use a drop-knee to establish and then trend up and left though a line of holds in the crack. Continue up the crack using a few hold on the face with your left hand as you move up the arete. Easy topout.
content.location: Right side of this small wall, this climb follows a crack up left from the base of the wall to the top of the right arete.

climbs.name: I Will NOT Go To Prom With You

content.description: Sit start with hands on the triangle shaped block, with feet low and out right. Pull on and bump the hands up right to the good jug edge above the start, trend right to good holds at about head height and from here either deadpoint to the lip of reach up with the left hand to a pinch high in the crack and bring the feet up so you can reach the right hand up to the lip.
content.location: Shared start with Ride the Furry Wall on the triangle-shaped block on the lower left side of this small face

climbs.name: A Cake Walk in A Ducky Park

content.description: Sit start with hands matched on the large blocky shelf at the base of the wall, pull on using small or smear feet, bump the right hand in to the better edge ~1' above the start, throw up a right heel and then stand up to a huge incut pinch in the middle of the wall. Match this pinch, bring the feet up as high as you can and then make a big reach up to good holds at the lip with an easy topout to finish.
content.location: Starts in the middle of this small face on the large blocky holds right at the bottom of the wall.

content.description: This small boulder is a nice stop if you are looking to check out all of the seaside climbing Narragansett has to offer or if you just wanted to hang out along the coast for a while and quickly cruise up a few easy lines, happily shaded from the summertime sun. Newtown Rock boasts nothing that will blow your socks off, but it has a few solid climbs at a lower grade. It is a great spot for bringing newer climbers as the problems are very short, they generally have positive holds to work with, and the downclimb is just walking around the back of the boulder.
